data.title: Taito corporation history
data.text:
2 Taito Corporation: one name, three companies.

In the past, the company had operated divisions in North America, Brazil, South Korea, Italy and the United Kingdom. Taito Corporation currently has a subsidiary in Beijing, China. Taito owns several arcades in Japan known as Taito Stations or Game Taito Stations. It has produced arcade games all around the world, while also importing and distributing American coin-op video games in Japan. Taito is known for producing hit arcade games, such as Space Invaders and Bubble Bobble. It has its headquarters in the Shinjuku Bunka Quint Building in Yoyogi, Shibuya, Tokyo, sharing the facility with its parent company. Taito is a wholly owned by publisher Square Enix.

It is also a former publisher of home video games.

The Taito Corporation ( 株式会社タイトー, Kabushikigaisha Taitō ?) (commonly referred to as Taito) is a Japanese video game developer and publisher of arcade hardwares and mobile phones, and an operator of video arcades.
